messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2609
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, thanks, thanks.  Marsie (5) wants to be able to stay by
messages.messageBody:
<<Holly wanted to stay home as early as six, when I would go to the store 2
blocks away>>

Thanks, thanks, thanks. Marsie (5) wants to be able to stay by herself but
I have been having to tell her no because it is a drive to get anywhere from
here. I had never thought of when we go on walks (up our couple of block
long road with very little traffic) or when I am out in the barn in the
mornings (within hollering distance) that I often do leave her alone if she
isn't interested in joining in. I hadn't thought of it as us "going
anywhere". Thanks again.

Julie
